facts: First woman to win a Nobel Prize and only person to win Nobel Prizes in two different sciences
Discovered the elements polonium and radium through meticulous isolation work
Won Nobel Prize in Physics (1903) and Chemistry (1911) for radioactivity research
Born in Poland as Maria Sk≈Çodowska, moved to Paris to study at the Sorbonne
Coined the term 'radioactivity' and developed mobile X-ray units during World War I
Founded the Radium Institute (now Curie Institute) in Paris for nuclear physics research
Her laboratory notebooks are still radioactive and will remain so for 1,500+ years
Died in 1934 from aplastic anemia, likely caused by prolonged exposure to radiation
